questions.text: I have people whose thinking challenges mine — they don't just agree with me, they sharpen me.
I have relationships where we discuss ideas, debate respectfully, and learn from each other.
I can be wrong in front of my intellectual friends without losing face — the relationship is secure enough for failure.
I contribute to others' intellectual growth as much as I receive — I'm not just taking, I'm giving.
My intellectual friendships have changed what I believe or how I think — they've had real impact.
